results.title: Spuds again
results.brief_description: Irrespresible and cheeky, Avis Quarrell was an avid church goer but liked nothing more than making fun of her superiors. One particular day landed her in hot water and back to peeling spuds.

results.title: Every man for himself
results.creator_credit: Arthur Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Hiding from the Germans amongst olive trees in Greece, Arthur Bedford and his fellow soldiers were told to get out. “Every man for himself”. Not only did they manage to escape, they managed to fend off a enemy bombing attack and didn’t suffer a single casualty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Hiding from the Germans amongst olive trees in Greece, Arthur Bedford and his fellow soldiers were told to get out. “Every man for himself”. Not only did they manage to escape, they managed to fend off a enemy bombing attack and didn’t suffer a single casualty.

results.title: Fishing on the Diamantina
results.creator_credit: Wayne Gwynne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wayne Gwynne joined the Navy in 1960 when he was 17. Spending 5 years at sea, during peacetime, Gwynne got to see things that no one has seen before. While he still can’t talk about those things, he loved his time at sea, especially on his favourite ship, the ‘Diamantina’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Gwynne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Battle of Coral
results.creator_credit: Tony Stewart, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Instinct kicked in when Private Tony Stewart and his fellow soldiers were engaged in the Battle for Coral, in Vietnam, 1968. It was the most horrific battle he would take part in but this is what Stewart was trained for and he know he had his mates there to look after him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Stewart, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: 22R&SU
results.creator_credit: Thomas Lawless, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Every young man wanted to be in the airforce but it was very selective. With technical training, Thomas Lawless found that he was most needed repairing and servicing aircraft during World War II. While being thrown into some intense situations, Lawless and his team formed strong bonds that could never be broken.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Lawless, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Every young man wanted to be in the airforce but it was very selective. With technical training, Thomas Lawless found that he was most needed repairing and servicing aircraft during World War II. While being thrown into some intense situations, Lawless and his team formed strong bonds that could never be broken.

With technical training, Thomas Lawless found that he was most needed repairing and servicing aircraft during World War II. While being thrown into some intense situations, Lawless and his team formed strong bonds that could never be broken.

results.title: The Things you do for a beer
results.creator_credit: Steve Whelan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When World War II broke out, some men would do anything to sign up and when the war was over, most men would do anything for a beer. Steve Whelan came from a family of servicemen and was eager to do his bit. He tells the story of how he and a group of fellow prisoners of war found a way to escape and find a beer.
results.title_for_label: The Things you do for a beer
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Whelan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When World War II broke out, some men would do anything to sign up and when the war was over, most men would do anything for a beer. Steve Whelan came from a family of servicemen and was eager to do his bit. He tells the story of how he and a group of fellow prisoners of war found a way to escape and find a beer.

Steve Whelan came from a family of servicemen and was eager to do his bit. He tells the story of how he and a group of fellow prisoners of war found a way to escape and find a beer.

results.title: A Look from their side
results.creator_credit: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.
description_for_label: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.

results.title: Tour of duty
results.creator_credit: Paul Rayment, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Rayment, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.
description_for_label: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.

results.title: Leave no man behind
results.creator_credit: Les Maher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Even though Les Maher believed you should never leave a man behind, there was a time in Vietnam that he had to make the decision to do so. Decades later, Maher has never forgotten and endeavoured to fulfil his promise.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Maher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Even though Les Maher believed you should never leave a man behind, there was a time in Vietnam that he had to make the decision to do so. Decades later, Maher has never forgotten and endeavoured to fulfil his promise.

results.title: The Boy who came in from the cold
results.creator_credit: Jack Darling, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred (Jack) Darling was a gunner on the ANZAC during the Korean War. The boys came up with as many ways as possible to overcome the Korean winter, including growing a beard, which required permission from the captain.
results.title_for_label: The Boy who came in from the cold
